name: 'Take a good look at yourself' –– Kitchen Owls Series #466
description:
'Take a good look at yourself' –– Kitchen Owls Series #466 Handmade. One-off. 45cm

Assemblage sculpture 'Take a good look at yourself' is one of over 650 unique sculptures from my 'Kitchen Owls' series. Each piece is one of a kind and full of character having been created with objects sourced from all around. 

A series of small owls created almost completely from recycled materials. 
As well as being ultra cute, these owls could serve to scare away any unwelcome avian thieves in your fruit trees until you're ready to pick them.

Made using a fan cage, steamers (black), WWI shaving mirrors, green jar lids, beer bottle tops, leaf tray, springs branch perch
* All items signed, numbered and dated (engraved on reverse). 
Due to the nature of using found objects, there may be scratches, scrapes, dents and other marks that serve as signs of the earlier use of those parts.

----------------------------------------------------
Looking for more Kitchen Owls? Duck on over to https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.122415274465922.9066.101635023210614&type=3 to view all available owls (includes pieces at stockists around Melbourne) and if something takes your fancy, contact us at focus@stewardson.net with the number of the piece.
----------------------------------------------------

name: 'Take the plunge' –– Kitchen Owls Series #541
description:
'Take the plunge' –– Kitchen Owls Series #541  Handmade. One-off. 8cm dia.

Assemblage sculpture 'Take the plunge' is one of over 650 unique sculptures from my 'Kitchen Owls' series. Each piece is one of a kind and full of character having been created with objects sourced from all around. 

A series of small owls created almost completely from recycled materials. 
As well as being ultra cute, these owls could serve to scare away any unwelcome avian thieves in your fruit trees until you're ready to pick them.

Made using a coffee plunger, spring valley lids, washers, buttons, springs & skewer.

name: 'Curl up' pendant/brooches -- 3 x Kitchen Owls and 1 x Sugar skull
description:
Focus on Art wearable art 'Curl up' pendant/brooches.   $50ea + P&H
4 x 4cm (3 x Owls and 1 x Sugar skull)

These pendant/brooches have been made using one end of a kitchen utensil -- a melon baller on one end and this, a butter curler, on the other. 

You can make your choice at Checkout and I will note any sold items in the description for future buyers. Just let me know the item number: 1 and 2 (top row) and 3 & 4 bottom row (left to right).

You can see what the pin back/bail looks like in the second image (showing a different pendant). The ones for the pendant/brooches in this listing have been sewn onto stiff felt first and then glued to the metal.

Choose from ball chain, leather thong (with or without catch), stiff wire necklet (black or silver colour) for use as a pendant.

Due to the nature of using found objects, there may be scratches, scrapes, dents and other marks that serve as signs of the earlier use of those parts.

PAYMENT OPTIONS: My preferred method of payment is direct deposit through internet transfer. Please mention this if you decide to buy this object. Thanks.

© 2012 Robyn Lee Stewardson (focusonart) -- All of my work is protected by copyright.

recycled, found objects, assemblage sculpture, metal, quirky, bird, owl, shiny, reclaimed, kitchen, kitchen utensil, nuts and bolts, environment

----------------------------------------------------

name: Gift Voucher $100
description:
Know someone who would LOVE one of our assemblage owls or creatures but don't know which one to choose? 
We now have Gift vouchers – $25, $50, $75 and $100 - with a 6 month life span making the job easy: let them choose themselves!
To purchase use the Contact Us link below our fan page profile picture.

name: 'Half your luck' –– Kitchen Owls Series #516
description:
'Half your luck' –– Kitchen Owls Series #516
Handmade. One-off. 6cm x 16cm

Assemblage sculpture 'Half your luck' is one of over 600 unique sculptures from my 'Kitchen Owls' series. Each piece is one of a kind and full of character having been created with objects sourced from all over. 

A series of small owls created almost completely from recycled materials. 
As well as being ultra cute, this owl could serve to scare away any unwelcome avian thieves in your fruit trees until you're ready to pick them.
Made using a tea strainer, beer bottle tops, star washers, half lucky coin, springs & skewer perch.

* All items signed, numbered and dated (engraved on the reverse). 
Due to the nature of using found objects, there may be scratches, scrapes, dents and other marks that serve as signs of the earlier use of those parts.
